            Mike McCarthy, PhD
          
          
            
              I am a data scientist and atmospheric chemist living in Sunny Southern California. I take great pride in providing high quality, science-based solutions that meet client needs.
              I earned a BS in Chemistry from Creighton University and my PhD in Atmospheric Chemistry at the University of California at Berkeley, where I measured and modeled stable isotopic compositions of the trace stratospheric gases CH4, CO2, and H2 to help constrain atmospheric greenhouse gas budgets.

articles.title: Welcome to Radical Research LLC!
articles.contents:
Radical Research LLC is Mike McCarthy’s new business venture. I am looking to make a significant difference! What does that mean (other than the obvious pun)?
I provide high quality science-based solutions to air quality challenges. Services include study design, quality assurance, analysis, and data automation and visualization. I have experience with study and analysis design on local-to-national spatial scales and diurnal-to-decadal temporal scales.
I hope to work with you in the future.

articles.title: Services
articles.contents:
Atmospheric chemistry: Hazardous air pollutants (air toxics), volatile organic compounds (VOCs), speciated particulate matter, near-road pollution
Interactive dashboard development: R Shiny, Rmarkdown, and API development
EPA NCore dashboard
EPA PM FRM QA dashboard
EPA ozone QA dashboard

Monitoring and network services: Study design, network assessment, risk assessment, community-scale monitoring, environmental justice
Statistical analysis: Regressions, source apportionment, hypothesis testing, cluster analysis, trend analysis, time-series analysis, geospatial analysis/GIS, distributions, model building, data mining
Quality assurance: Quality management plans (QMPs), Quality assurance project plans (QAPPs), and automated QA/QC algorithms
Training: Statistics, R, atmospheric science, and community-monitoring
